name: Unfixed level, or strong on every level, builds
author: Thorsson

posts.author: Thorsson
posts.content:
So, I'm coming back to NWN for the first time in 10 years due to the upcoming NWN:EE. While I'm waiting for that to be finished I decided I wanted to play some of the modules that have been released more recently, where I can (some are buggy as yet).

Now you can go online and find out about these modules, but that spoils things, so I'd prefer just to walk into the module with no knowledge except that which the module maker cares to impart.

The second module I tried (the first got stuck on a cut scene) was ShadowGuard. That gives you no information, so you are in the dark as what might be needed, at what level you start (actually it's 3) and what level you end.

So my question is, when you're in such a circumstance and you want to be effective at every level, what would you choose?

Just to get things started, my choice (I'm into Bards at the moment, so this somewhat informed this) was as follows:

Race Human - liked the extra Feat and skill points and not having to worry about an XP penalty as I was making this up as I went along
Stats: 16/13/14/14/8/11 - in the long run that's probably more dex than I need, so a difficult decision
Level 1 Bard - You get lots of skills and you're reasonably effective in combat thanks to Bard Song; Feats: Luck of Heroes, Dodge (I know in the long run Dodge isn't a great Feat unless you need it for pre-reqs, but in early levels it can be very handy)
Level 2 Fighter - Weapon and Armor proficiencies and a free Feat (I chose Blind Fight)
Level 3 Bard - Wanted skills and a spell was useful too, as it became obvious that this was a low magic environment. Feat: Extra Music 
Level 4 Fighter - For the extra Feat, decided by this time to focus on a weapon. I chose Longsword. Increase Strength.
Level 5 Bard for the boost to Bard Song and skills.
This is as far as I have got, but my thought was to take 2 levels of RDD next for the AC & Str. Longer run making sure I have 16BAB at 20, getting RDD10 and taking lots of Great Strengths in Epic; not sure on the best split between Fighter & Bard though.

I've put skill points into Discipline, Lore, Perform, Spellcraft, Spot (just a couple at level 1 so far), Tumble and UMD.

Anyway, comments on my choices, future plans and alternative builds would all be gratefully accepted.

I don't know that module, but I'm a bard enthusiast :) What is the Cha on that build? Looks like 11 from your summary, but you need at least 14 in a low magic environment and max out Perform otherwise your Bard Song will not gain power with your Bard levels.

I usually take no more than two Fighter levels and keep pure Bard for the rest unless you are going past level 14 or so. The Curse Song (feat) is incredibly powerful and a must have for a Bard, especially at low levels.

Enjoy!

posts.author: Thorsson
posts.content: Thanks. Good point about a low magic environment, because you never know what you're going to get in terms of items.

posts.author: impracticaldogg
posts.content:
Bard spells are also only available to a level equal to Cha - 10. So a bard with a natural 14 Cha can cast up to 4th level spells.

Sent from my 2014817 using Tapatalk

posts.author: Thorsson
posts.content: Surely if you have Cha 13 and a +1 Cha Ring you can cast level 4 spells?

posts.author: MrZork
posts.content:
Thorsson wrote: Surely if you have Cha 13 and a +1 Cha Ring you can cast level 4 spells?
I am pretty sure that the spellcaster must have a natural spellcasting ability equal to the spell level + 10. And, keep in mind that CHA-based casters only get to choose known spells at level-up and the PC has no buffing effects considered during level-up (same reason an INT=10 toon wearing a +3 INT ring still doesn't qualify for Expertise during level-up). So, it seems unlikely that a CHA=13 toon would even be able to choose any level 4 spells to know.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
A bard with a natural Cha 13 can not learn/ choose spells higher than spell-level 3. Items and buffs do not help.
If said bard wears a Cha +1 item so Cha becomes 14, she will be able to cast lvl 2 spells 1 extra time per day because of the bonus "slot".
The spells DC will also improve by +1.

posts.author: MrZork
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote: You might be able to use lvl 4 slots for metamagic. I don't know for sure because I don't play casters.
I am not even sure about that. I just rolled up a level 4 wizard with 11 INT and the Extend feat. Even with a +3 INT ring equipped, he could not access any level 2 slots. I also equipped a Wanderer's Ring with bonus wizard slots from level 1 - 4. Still no slots available above level 1. Looks like a toon needs to meet the casting ability requirement for a given level of spell to even have access to slots of that level for any purpose. (I haven't tested with a spontaneous caster.)
